INIT().details: This function is called when the module is installed or upgraded by the kernel.MUST BE GATED BY onlyKernel. Used to encompass any initialization or upgrade logic.

returns.major: - Major version upgrade indicates breaking change to the interface.
returns.minor: - Minor version change retains backward-compatible interface.

increaseDebtorApproval(address,address,u.details: Debt will generally be taken by contracts to allocate treasury funds in yield sources.

repayDebt(address,address,uint256).details: Only confirmed to safely handle standard and non-standard ERC20s.Can have unforeseen consequences with ERC777. Be careful with ERC777 as reserve.

VERSION().notice: Returns which semantic version of a module is being implemented.

active().notice: Status of the treasury. If false, no withdrawals or debt can be incurred.

changeKernel(address).notice: Function used by kernel when migrating to a new kernel.

debtApproval(address,address).notice: Mapping of who is approved to incur debt.

decreaseDebtorApproval(address,address,u.notice: Decrease approval for someone to withdraw reserves as debt.

decreaseWithdrawApproval(address,address.notice: Decrease approval for specific withdrawer addresses

getReserveBalance(address).notice: Get total balance of assets inside the treasury + any debt taken out against those assets.

increaseDebtorApproval(address,address,u.notice: Increase approval for someone to accrue debt in order to withdraw reserves.

increaseWithdrawApproval(address,address.notice: Increase approval for specific withdrawer addresses

incurDebt(address,uint256).notice: Pre-approved policies can get a loan to perform operations with treasury assets.

reserveDebt(address,address).notice: Debt for particular token and debtor address

setDebt(address,address,uint256).notice: An escape hatch for setting debt in special cases, like swapping reserves to another token.

totalDebt(address).notice: Total debt for token across all withdrawals.

withdrawApproval(address,address).notice: Mapping of who is approved for withdrawal.

withdrawReserves(address,address,uint256.notice: Allow withdrawal of reserve funds from pre-approved addresses.

documentation.text: @notice Status of the treasury. If false, no withdrawals or debt can be incurred.

@notice Mapping of who is approved for withdrawal.
 @dev    withdrawer -> token -> amount. Infinite approval is max(uint256).

@notice Mapping of who is approved to incur debt.
 @dev    debtor -> token -> amount. Infinite approval is max(uint256).
@notice Total debt for token across all withdrawals.
@notice Debt for particular token and debtor address
@notice Increase approval for specific withdrawer addresses
@notice Decrease approval for specific withdrawer addresses
@notice Allow withdrawal of reserve funds from pre-approved addresses.

@notice Increase approval for someone to accrue debt in order to withdraw reserves.
 @dev    Debt will generally be taken by contracts to allocate treasury funds in yield sources.
@notice Decrease approval for someone to withdraw reserves as debt.
@notice Pre-approved policies can get a loan to perform operations with treasury assets.
@notice An escape hatch for setting debt in special cases, like swapping reserves to another token.
@notice Get total balance of assets inside the treasury + any debt taken out against those assets.
@notice Treasury holds all other assets under the control of the protocol.
